===Etymology===
{{Han simp|來|f=从|t=䒑}} – fruit hanging on a tree 木, the coming of harvest; alternatively, ear of grain, as in [[禾]]. Meaning of “come” influenced by derived character [[麥]].

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|らい|yomi=on}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=らい}} {{m|ltc|來|tr=*ləi}}. Compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} traditional {{m|cmn|來}} and simplified {{m|cmn|来|tr=lái}}.

====Pronunciation====
* [[音読み|On'yomi]]
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[ɺ̠a̠i]}}

====Prefix====
{{ja-pos|prefix|らい|kyu=來}}

# [[next]], [[coming]] (week, year, etc.)
#*: {{ja-usex|'''来'''年、'''来'''週|'''らい'''ねん、 '''らい'''しゅう|'''next''' year, '''next''' week}}
#*: {{ja-usex|'''来'''週月曜日に会いましょう。|'''らい'''しゅう げつようび に あいましょう。|Let's meet Monday '''next'''. / Let's meet this '''coming''' Monday.}}

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|らい|kyu=來}}

# {{surname|lang=ja|sort=らい}}

====Suffix====
{{ja-pos|suffix|らい|kyu=來}}

# [[since]], [[in]] (a span of time)
#*: {{ja-usex|三年'''来'''あれを見ていない。|さん ねん-'''らい''' あれ を みていない。|I haven't seen that '''in''' three years / '''since''' three years ago.}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|く|yomi=kun}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=く}}. The verb ''ku'' is one of the few [[monosyllabic]] verb roots in Japanese. This developed into [[来る|''kuru'']] in modern Japanese.

====Pronunciation====
* [[訓読み|Kun'yomi]]
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[kɯᵝ]}}

====Verb====
{{ja-verb|type=3|く|kyu=來}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=く|obsolete}} to approach one's position from a remote location: to [[come]]
#: Developed into {{ja-l|来る|くる|kuru}} in modern Japanese.
